item.title: The Real Banking Problem - Feb 13,2012
item.description:
Youve heard all about the fraud, the games, the bad securities and the rest over the last two years. Today, youll hear why I believe none of it has been prosecuted, and why it wont be until we make major changes at all levels of government. The bad news? If we dont make those changes soon -- very soon -- it wont matter whether we try to do it at all.

item.title: Europe, The US, And Continuing Government Fraud - Jan 16,2012
item.description:
Lets face it folks -- its all a scam at all levels of government. Borrowing to fund ordinary government operations is nothing else. And you, as a voter, are both complicit in the fraud and in fact demand it -- which means youre entitled to exactly nothing when it comes to those promised entitlements you know cant be paid for. Yeah, this is not "happy talk", but it is the truth. Well go through it all, from top to bottom, in 30 minutes,.

item.title: Less Stupid Please - Nov 21,2011
item.description:
The "stuporcommittee" fails, or so we think anyway. Meanwhile Newt tells OWS to "take a shower then go get a job" while demonstrators who are peacefully sitting at UC -- actual students who paid tuition and thus have a right to be there -- are attacked by the police with bear spray. And its the demonstrators who are initiating violence? Hmmm.... Well look at the upcoming silly season but more importantly look at what is not being talked about but must be - the fact that we cannot continue to spend more than we take in, either as a nation, as a government, or as people.

item.title: Europe Goes ENRON - Sep 26,2011
item.description:
Unbelievable. The latest sticksave is that the Eurozone intends to use the EFSF to "lever up" by creating a SPV and then playing with the ECB on the bonds it issues. This, of course, is the same crap that ENRON pulled, and the opacity of SPVs makes them inherently a "trust me" off-balance sheet instrument. Ive ranted about these "structures" before, and now theyre being proposed at a sovereign level. Well look at it, but you dont have to listen if you want to know if I like it.

item.title: The Market .vs. The Lie - Aug 22,2011
item.description:
Which do you care to believe? The claims that there are no liquidity problems, or Bank of America, which is trading down more than 6% today and has credit protection blowing wide. Remember in 2008 that we were told that both Bear Stearns and Lehman were just fine, right up until they blew up. In the latter case we have a forensic report on the bankruptcy that discloses the fact that Citibank, along with many others (including with essential certainty the NY Fed) knew full well the company had no valid collateral for repos for quite a long time before they blew up. They said nothing, but you can bet those who knew traded on it. Is it happening again? Well explore not just here but the same implications in Europe - and what, politically, must be done right now.

Incidentally, both end the same way.

item.title: Accountability - Or Lack Thereof - Jan 10,2011
item.description:
A Shooting in Tuscon. Rampant corruption in the financial markets. The underwear bomber. Ruby Ridge. What do these all have in common? Simple - a government that's incompetent, and a citizenry unwilling to hold it to account. If you want the solution to problems you first must identify what they are, and then call out those who caused the problems you face. Passing laws is immaterial if the existing laws aren't enforced. We'll discuss and debate, along with covering the markets, including Bangladesh, which crashed overnight.

The banksters have managed to - thus far - get every nation to kneel before them and perform an obscene act. Who will stop them? Anyone? Does it stop only when everything collapses - when all that we hold dear and have had is gone? We'll discuss... you decide.

item.description:
As we come into Thanksgiving, one question arises - what are we giving thanks for? Is the basic set of liberties that our forefathers fou9ght and died for still alive? We'll explore the implications of not only the TSA nonsense but also the other loss of liberties over the decades - and how we, as sheep, quietly consent as we meander toward literal slavery.

item.title: Dishonesty All Around: Monetary and Security - Nov 15,2010
item.description:
As expected, we're now seeing the "results" of QE2 - and they're not encouraging. We're also seeing the pushback. Heh, better late than never, right? Maybe. This assumes that someone stops this idiocy before a significant percentage of the population finds itself hungry and homeless - or worse. We'll also cover the latest "Security Theater" garbage from the TSA. It's time to "Just Say No" to this sort of crap. I've dubbed them "The Sexual Assault" and on the show you'll find out why - and what you can do (legally) about it.

item.title: Gimme A Stick For My Teeth - Oct 25,2010
item.description:
You know it's coming, so get ready. Today: Dollar down 0.5%, Corn up 1.9%, Wheat up 1.2%, Oats up 4.5%, Soy up 1.5%. Bernanke has now been proved a liar in regard to his 2006 statements, and yet he continues to dissemble - while the banking system strips Americans to the bone. Vote next week? For whom? Have you heard any candidate or politician promise to put a stop to this crap, or recover the money stolen from Americans by the banks? Nope. So gimme a stick - I don't want to bite my tongue.

item.description:
Nationalization of banks? What's with FIFTEEN YEARS of knowledge of these frauds and more than 10 years of no trades? Housing plan announced; its a joke. What's with protecting "homeowners" who lied on their mortgage applications - a federal offense. The market continues to vote on the administration's plans, and that vote is NO CONFIDENCE. Time to go Mr. Geithner. Oh, and AIG is expected to report a SIXTY BILLION loss and cry for more bailout money. Aieee....
